text: Inhibition of T cell signaling by mitogen - activated protein kinase - targeted <extra_id_0> hematopoietic tyrosine phosphatase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) .

Activation of T lymphocytes to produce cytokines is regulated by the counterbalance of protein - tyrosine kinases and protein - tyrosine phosphatases , many of which have a high degree of substrate specificity because of physical association with their targets .

Overexpression of <extra_id_0> hematopoietic protein-tyrosine phosphatase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) results in suppression of T lymphocyte activation as measured by T cell antigen receptor - induced activation of transcription factors binding to the 5 ' promoter of the <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

text: Efforts to pinpoint the exact site of action and specificity of <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the signaling cascade revealed that <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> acts directly on the mitogen - activated protein ( MAP ) kinases <extra_id_0> Erk1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and consequently reduces the magnitude and duration of their catalytic activation in intact T cells .

text: In contrast , <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> had no effects on N-terminal c-Jun kinase or on events upstream of the MAP kinases .

The specificity of <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> correlated with its physical association through its noncatalytic N terminus with Erk and another MAP kinase , p38 , but not Jnk or other proteins .

We propose that <extra_id_0> HePTP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> plays a negative role in antigen receptor signaling by specifically regulating MAP kinases in the cytosol and at early time points of T cell activation before the activation - induced expression of nuclear dual - specific MAP kinase phosphatases .
